Australia:
A National Australasian Convention met and agreed on adopting the name "the Commonwealth of Australia," also drafting a constitution.
The first attempt at a federal constitution was drafted.
The Convention adopts the constitution, although it had no legal status
A severe depression hit Australia
Brazil:
First revolt of the Armada.
The constitution of the First Brazilian Republic is promulgated.
President Deodoro da Fonseca resigns as a consequence of the first revolt of the Armada, vice president Floriano Peixoto succeeds to the presidency.
Deposed emperor Dom Pedro II dies in Paris, France aged 66.
Chile: 1891 Chilean Civil War. The constitutional president José Manuel Balmaceda is overthrown by troops favorable to the National Congress. The beginning of "Parliamentarism".
China: Foreign businessmen established the Shanghai Sharebrokers' Association in Shanghai.
Japan: 1891 Mino–Owari earthquake – strongest recorded inland earthquake of Japan
Philippine: Rizal finishes writing El Filibusterismo in Biarritz, France
El Filibusterismo published in Ghent, Belgium
Russia: Severe famine affects almost half of Russia's provinces
Slovenia:
The railway line on the route Ljubljana – Kamnik is built.
The railway line on the route Celje – Velenje is built.
Taiwan: Construction of the Taipei-Keelung road is completed
